intro: Calvoa henriquesii, commonly known as the Henriques' calvoa, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Azores. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats, such as forest understories. Its leaves are lanceolate and often covered in a fine pubescence. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered vulnerable to environmental changes.
